oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Two-Fluid Theory for Spin Superfluidity in Magnetic Insulators
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Flebus, B.
Bender, S. A.
Tserkovnyak, Y.
Duine, R. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We investigate coupled spin and heat transport in easy-plane magnetic insulators. These materials display a continuous phase transition between normal and condensate states that is controlled by an external magnetic field. Using hydrodynamic equations supplemented by Gross-Pitaevski phenomenology and magnetoelectric circuit theory, we derive a two-fluid model to describe the dynamics of thermal and condensed magnons, and the appropriate boundary conditions in a hybrid normal-metal|magnetic-insulator|normal-metal heterostructure. We discuss how the emergent spin superfluidity can be experimentally probed via a spin Seebeck effect measurement.
